dt: {bc}a branch of {d_link|morphology|morphology} that deals with the structure of organisms
{bc}the art of separating the parts of an organism in order to ascertain their position, relations, structure, and function {bc}{sx|dissection||}
{bc}a body dissected or to be dissected
{bc}structural makeup especially of an organism or any of its parts
{bc}a separating or dividing into parts for detailed examination {bc}{sx|analysis||}

dt.t: wore an outfit that showed off various parts of her {wi}anatomy{/wi}

et: Late Latin {it}anatomia{/it} dissection, from Greek {it}anatomē{/it}, from {it}anatemnein{/it} to dissect, from {it}ana-{/it} + {it}temnein{/it} to cut
shortdef: a branch of morphology that deals with the structure of organisms
a treatise on anatomical science or art
the art of separating the parts of an organism in order to ascertain their position, relations, structure, and function : dissection

dt: {bc}a branch of anatomy that deals with the macroscopic structure of tissues and organs

shortdef: a branch of anatomy that deals with the macroscopic structure of tissues and organs
